comments:
I have a visual class that I started working on in 3.01 after upgrading to 3.1
and the official 1.1 I did have it working.  I added a menu to the application.
Even though VE does not support SWT menus the editor seemed to be happy to
ignore it.  At some point I made a change that caused VE to issue an 
error "The feature control is not a valid feature" message and display a read 
only editor.  Below are the log entries:

Created an attachment (id=26000)
Eclipse project with a visual class that causes the error.

As requested in the news group (see
http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/article.php?id=4274&group=eclipse.tools.ve#4274)

I have created a defect and attached the visual class.	Actually I attached a
full project.  I stripped out all my personal common libraries and butchered
the code so it compiles cleanly.  The VE problem is still there even though the

application will not run any more.

I fixed it so that you don't get these log errors, but swt MenuItems don't work
right yet. At least with the fix the editor can come up.

This part of the fix has been released to HEAD.

Verified on VE build 20050824.

Menuitems show up on the canvas because VE doesn't know how to handle the code
pattern in which the parent is past in to a method and used on subsequent
contructors (e.g. private void createQueryMenu (Menu parentMenu) ).

But there were no log errors.

traces.message: The feature 'control' is not a valid  feature
The feature 'control' is not a valid  feature)

causedBy.message: The feature 'control' is not a  valid feature
